posts.author: SuperDuperCoolDude
posts.content:
Hey I am wondering what you think would be the ideal mix for a strength based unarmed monk to take through Aielund Saga or otherwise. I am planning 4 levels of fighter for weapon specialization and the bonus feats. I also plan to take at least 4 full BAB levels pre 20 for the max number of attacks. I will probably do the usual skills like discipline, persuade, lore and I may try heal for ease of hit point replenishment. I would probably take at least 16 or 20 monk. I am thinking either human or dwarf, leaning towards dwarf since anyway the build goes I am not dying for skill points or an extra feat. My two main options are:

CoT: This gives a great saving throw bonus, 5 bonus feats in 10 levels, and continues to be a good investment if I want to only take 20 monk. I am not sure how beneficial the saving throw bonuses would be, as monks have pretty awesome saving throws anyway. The bonus feat list is also kinda eh, since monks already get knock down, cleave and improved knockdown. If I want to go for the epic critical feats though the early bonus feats would be nice for meeting those requirements while also picking up the better general feats. I am not crazy about the critical feats though as an unarmed monk doesn't make great use of them. I would have to take a random melee weapon focus to qualify too CoT can take great wisdom as an epic bonus feat though which is nice.

DD: This gives d12 for hitpoints, damage soak, immunity to flanking, and defensive stance. This is tankier minus the lower saving throws. There's also 5 missing bonus feats which could be pretty unfortunate.

Alternatively, I suppose I could just do CoT/DD/Monk and skip the 4 fighter levels. I would lose 6 damage per hit though, and epic fighters still get a bonus feat every two levels which is handy. Also, since the circle kick bug is fixed in EE I am wondering if it is worthwhile. I know switching targets might be annoying, but an extra attack a round (at full AB right?) seems pretty potent.
Any suggestions?
